description:
Create a modern landing page for curious.ai - a news curation platform. The page should have:

1. A clean navbar with the curious.ai logo/name on the left and Login/Sign Up buttons on the right

2. A hero section with:
   - Headline: 'Your Personal News Intelligence'
   - Subheadline explaining how the app curates news from multiple sources using AI
   - A CTA button 'Get Started' that links to signup

3. A brief features section (3-4 cards) highlighting:
   - Multi-source aggregation (Twitter, RSS feeds)
   - AI-powered curation with Gemini
   - Voice narration of news summaries
   - Smart clustering of related stories

4. A minimal footer with copyright curious.ai 2026

Use a clean, modern design with a light theme. Primary color should be a vibrant purple/indigo similar to the nBot reference. Keep it simple and elegant - this is a demo.

Create a complete authentication system with the following pages:

1. SIGNUP PAGE (/signup):
   - Email input field with validation
   - Password input field with strength indicator
   - Confirm password field
   - 'Sign Up with Email' button
   - 'Continue with Google' button (OAuth integration placeholder - will show a styled button)
   - Link to login page at bottom: 'Already have an account? Log in'
   - Form validation with error messages

2. LOGIN PAGE (/login):
   - Email input field
   - Password input field
   - 'Log In' button
   - 'Continue with Google' button
   - 'Forgot Password?' link (can be placeholder)
   - Link to signup: 'Don't have an account? Sign up'

3. PROFILE PAGE (/profile):
   - User avatar/initial
   - User email display
   - 'My Curators' section showing a list of saved curators (hardcoded for demo: 'AI & Tech News', 'Sports Updates', 'Global Politics')
   - Each curator shows name, date created, and sources used
   - 'Create New Curator' button that links to /curator page
   - Logout button

Use the same design language as the landing page. Store user session in localStorage for the demo. The navbar should update to show user avatar/name when logged in instead of Login/Sign Up buttons.

Create the main CURATOR PAGE (/curator) - this is the core functionality page. Reference the design from /home/user/Attachments/158abf09-1522-4126-8908-e1bd868d871b.jpeg for the layout.

The page should have:

1. HEADER:
   - Same navbar as other pages
   - Main title: 'What do you want to follow?'

2. PROMPT INPUT:
   - Large text input area with placeholder 'Tell me a topic, trend, or interest...'
   - Arrow/submit button on the right side of the input
   - Below the input, show suggestion chips/pills like: 'AI startup funding news', 'Cricket highlights', 'Geopolitics analysis', 'Health & wellness'

3. SOURCE SELECTION SECTION:
   - Text: 'or add a source directly'
   - Two clickable source cards in a row:
     a) X/Twitter card with Twitter icon
     b) RSS Feed card with RSS icon
   - When user clicks Twitter card, show a modal/popup with 3 hardcoded Twitter accounts to select:
     * @TechGuru_AI (avatar, handle, bio: 'AI researcher and tech enthusiast')
     * @AINewsDaily (avatar, handle, bio: 'Your daily dose of AI updates')
     * @GlobalPulse (avatar, handle, bio: 'World news and analysis')
   - Each account has a checkbox to select/deselect
   - When user clicks RSS card, show a modal with 3 hardcoded RSS sources:
     * TechCrunch AI (https://techcrunch.com/ai/feed)
     * ESPN Sports (https://espn.com/rss/news)
     * Reuters World (https://reuters.com/world/feed)
   - Each RSS source has a checkbox to select/deselect
   - Selected sources should show as pills/tags below the source cards

4. GENERATE BUTTON:
   - A prominent 'Generate News Feed' button that becomes active when user has entered a prompt
   - This button will navigate to /results page (functionality to be added later)

Store selected sources and prompt in state. Use the same design language - light theme, clean cards, the gradient accents.
